conclusion: Object A starts moving from the right with initial power towards the group of blocks.
The trajectory of A is indicated by the red arrow.
A will collide with the small orange block first.
During the collision with the orange block, A transfers momentum to the block, causing it to move.
A's velocity decreases and direction likely deflects after colliding with the orange block.
A is expected to move towards the blue block after deflection.
A will collide with the blue block, further reducing its velocity and changing direction.
Momentum is transferred to the blue block during the collision.
A's path likely leads it to collide with the green block after the blue block.
Collision with the green block further slows down A and potentially deflects it.
Momentum is transferred to the green block during the collision.
Friction between A and the green surface opposes A's motion, causing it to slow down.
A may continue to slide or collide with other blocks depending on remaining momentum and deflections.
A's kinetic energy will eventually be dissipated, and it will come to a stop.
A is expected to stop somewhere to the left of the green block, within the cluster of blocks.
Visual inspection suggests the arrow points towards the area of larger green blocks in the lower left.
Blocks A will collide with: the small orange block, the blue block, and the green block.
A will eventually stop in the area to the left of the green block, likely near the larger green blocks.
